captions.text:
The fact is,
he's the sponsor

And you signed a contract
guaranteeing him
certain concessions,

One of them being
a spot on the show.

That's where I see things
just a little differently.

Contract or no, I will
not bow to any sponsor.

I'm sorry
you feel that way,

But basically,
it's the nature
of the beast.

Maybe I'm wrong
on this one,

But for me, the beast
doesn't include selling out.

Garth, you know what
I'm talking about,
right?

It's, like, people
only do things
because they get paid,

And that's
just really sad.

I can't talk about it
anymore. It's giving me
a headache.

Here.
Take two of these.
Ah. Nuprin.

Little. Yellow.
Different.

You can stay here
in the big leagues
And play by the rules

Or go back to
the farm club in aurora.
It's your choice.

Yes. And
it's the choice
of a new generation.

title: Wayne's World (6/10) Movie CLIP - I Will Not Bow to Any Sponsor (1992) HD

comments.text: little. yellow. different.﻿

comments.author: elcap22

comments.text:
+elcap22 The joke is both the irony and what it's parodying. When Wayne 
says "Contract or no, I will not bow to any sponsor", then showcasing 
branded products like Doritos and Pepsi to show irony in that statement. 
This also makes fun of the fact that Companies will pay much to have their 
products shown in film, like Man Of Steel

comments.author: Bang Bang

comments.text:
Wow, how times change. This scene was written as a joke, a subversive way 
to point out how obnoxious corporate product placement is. Flash forward to 
Meyer's later movie, "The Cat in the Hat" where he plugs the Universal 
Studios ride. He even says, "Ka-Ching!" at the end of the plug. It was the 
most whoreish sales pitch I've ever seen in my life.﻿

comments.author: Ernest Pagnozzi

comments.text:
Wow, this scene just really aggravates me to a point of existentialism. 
Over at r/hailcorporate we are fully aware that popular culture has 
permeated so far into our own lives that we ourselves are acting 
unknowingly as shills for a multitude of things. It's amazing how movies 
will shamelessly berate us with their pleads to purchase their product, as 
is done in this scene here. I ask that we unite in boycotting the products 
mentioned here, in order to show that we will not be sheep among shepherd.

Atticus T. Polk, reddit gold user and moderator of r/malefashionadvice, 
r/tea, and r/hailcorporate﻿
